summary: The "Bureau of the EP" refers to the administrative body of the European Parliament (EP), responsible for supporting its legislative functions and ensuring efficient operations within the institution. This bureau plays a pivotal role in the EU's regulatory framework, facilitating communication between various EU institutions and enhancing the Parliament's capacity to fulfill its democratic mandate. It oversees the implementation of internal rules and procedures, thereby contributing to the transparency and accountability of the EP. The Bureau also manages the Parliament's budget and resources, ensuring compliance with EU financial regulations and promoting effective governance within the European civil service.
